titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his papers at Syracuse University

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of the American author, novelist, short story writer; died 1971. Specialized in books relating to early New York State and United States history. Correspondence (1938-1971), manuscripts, notes, photographs, research material, and a scrapbook of book reviews.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p:
Harvey Chalmers (1890-1971) was an American author, novelist, and short story writer known for his historical fiction relating to early New York State and United States history. Born in Amsterdam, he operated a pearl button factory in New York for many years until the advent of plastic buttons put it out of business. His first novel,
West to the Setting Sun, was published in 1943 (the same year he became president of the button company). His other books include
Drums Against Frontenac,
The Last Stand of the Nez Perce, and
The Birth of the Erie Canal (with John H. Flandreau). He also served as consultant to the State Department of Education.

[Adapted from Mr Chalmers' obituary in the
New York Times, 8 Oct 1971, p. 46]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Harvey Chalmers Papers consist of several accessions, some of which have been integrated with the main collection and some of which have not. The main collection consists of correspondence-subject files, writings, and memorabilia. Two later accessions, listed at the end of the inventory, contain 1) short stories and 2) correspondence, memorabilia, and writings.

Correspondence-subject files contain incoming and outgoing correspondence, covering the years 1938 to 1964, news clippings, holographic notes, and lists of names and addresses. Chalmers' writings include
Books, short stories, play (holographic notes for books, original and carbon typescript chapters and short stories, and carbons of a play),
Magazine articles, and other
Published material.
Memorabilia contains photographs and sketches, and an oversized scrapbook containing book reviews complete the main collection.
This series contains drafts, bound drafts, typescripts, and manuscripts of numerous short stories and books. Some folders also contain criticism and correspondence.
This series contains correspondence (1846-1971), memorabilia (1935-1961), and writings (pamphlets, books, notes, research material, and typescripts).
Note that box numbering restarts with Box 1 for each of the two later additions. When requesting a box please be sure to specify both box number and series to ensure retrieval of the correct items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: In the main collection, series are arranged alphabetically by topic (correspondence-subject files), type (memorabilia), or title (writings). Short stories (later addition) are in no particular order. The 1978 addition is arranged alphabetically.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
